attr: FIXME: Version of the csi2host with a single bit??
Payload Bypass test mode for double ECC errors
Clock lane in Ultra Low Power state
Indicates that the clock lane is actively receiving a DDR clock
Lane module3 has entered the Ultra Low Power mode
Lane module2 has entered the Ultra Low Power mode
Lane module1 has entered the Ultra Low Power mode
Lane module0 has entered the Ultra Low Power mode
Packet crc error of lane2 when sw_cphy_en=1.
Packet crc error of lane1 when sw_cphy_en=1.
Packet crc error of lane0 when sw_cphy_en=1.
Checksum error detected on virtual channel 3.
Checksum error detected on virtual channel 2.
Checksum error detected on virtual channel 1.
Checksum error detected on virtual channel 0.
Last received frame, in virtual channel 3, had at least one CRC error.
Last received frame, in virtual channel 2, had at least one CRC error.
Last received frame, in virtual channel 1, had at least one CRC error.
Last received frame, in virtual channel 0, had at least one CRC error.
Incorrect frame sequence detected in virtual channel 3.
Incorrect frame sequence detected in virtual channel 2.
Incorrect frame sequence detected in virtual channel 1.
Incorrect frame sequence detected in virtual channel 0.
Error matching frame start with frame end for virtual channel 3.
Error matching frame start with frame end for virtual channel 2.
Error matching frame start with frame end for virtual channel 1.
Error matching frame start with frame end for virtual channel 0.
Start of transmission error on data lane 3.
Start of transmission error on data lane 2.
Start of transmission error on data lane 1.
Start of transmission error on data lane 0 (no synchronization achieved).
Lane 3 receive invalid code when sw_cphy_en=1.
Lane 2 receive invalid code when sw_cphy_en=1.
Lane 1 receive invalid code when sw_cphy_en=1.
Lane 0 receive invalid code when sw_cphy_en=1.
Unrecognized or unimplemented data type detected in virtual channel 3.
Unrecognized or unimplemented data type detected in virtual channel 2.
Unrecognized or unimplemented data type detected in virtual channel 1.
Unrecognized or unimplemented data type detected in virtual channel 0.
Header error detected and corrected on virtual channel 3.
Header error detected and corrected on virtual channel 2.
Header error detected and corrected on virtual channel 1.
Header error detected and corrected on virtual channel 0.
Start of transmission error on data lane 3 (synchronization can still be achieved).
Start of transmission error on data lane 2 (synchronization can still be achieved).
Start of transmission error on data lane 1 (synchronization can still be achieved).
Start of transmission error on data lane 0 (synchronization can still be achieved).
Escape entry error(ULPM) on data lane 3.
Escape entry error(ULPM) on data lane 2.
Escape entry error(ULPM) on data lane 1.
Escape entry error(ULPM) on data lane 0.
Phase 0 is earliest and phase 7 is latest. Each step between the adjacent phase is about 40ps.
Phase 0 is earliest and phase 7 is latest. Each step between the adjacent phase is about 40ps.
Phase 0 is earliest and phase 7 is latest. Each step between the adjacent phase is about 40ps.
MSB of lane_2_phase in next register LANE_2_1_0_PHASE.
Must be used with bit lane_2_phase_msb in previous register LANE_CLK_3_PHASE.
Phase 0 is earliest and phase 7 is latest. Each step between the adjacent phase is about 40ps.
Phase 0 is earliest and phase 7 is latest. Each step between the adjacent phase is about 40ps.
Whether to reverse the digital sample clock (negative) or not (positive).
Whether to enable (dual) clock lanes mode or not (single).
Phase 0 is earliest and phase 7 is latest. Each step between the adjacent phase is about 40ps.
Phase 0 is earliest and phase 7 is latest. Each step between the adjacent phase is about 40ps.
The value of counter for Tta-go of turnaround. Tta-go = Ttxclkesc * value
The value of counter for Tta-sure of turnaround. Tta-sure = Ttxclkesc * value
The value of counter for Tta-wait of turnaround. Tta-wait = Ttxclkesc * value
The count time of THS-SETTLE. After the count done, D-PHY will begin to receive the high speed data.
Reference voltage-325mV for CD Function control pin.
Reference voltage-400mV for LP_REG Function control pin.
Reference voltage-400mV/200mV for HS Function control pin, the left value is selected when I_MUX_SEL is set to 0x0 and the right value is selected when I_MUX_SEL is set to 0x1.
Reference voltage-645mV for LP Function control pin.
PLL Control Logic Block Enable Register. For using PLL in PHY module, user can set this register after setting registers.
Register for Division Value of the 3-bit Programmable Scaler.
Register for Division Value of the 6-bit Programmable Pre-Divider. PLL has to be reset if P value is changed.
Shadow Register Enable Register. For using frequency hopping function in PHY, user can set this register before controlling the interface signal PLL_CFG_UPDT.
M_ESCREF Output Enable Register. When user wants to measure the Escape Clock of Master Lanes, set this register.
Register for Scaler's Re-initialization Time Control Pin.
Register for Monitoring Pin. If FEED_EN is 1, FEED_OUT is enabled.
Register for Division Value of the 10-bit Programmable Main-Divider. PLL has to be reset if M value is changed.
Register for Value of 6-bit Modulation Rate Control. PLL has to be reset if MRR is changed.
Register for Value of 8-bit Modulation Frequency Control. PLL has to be reset if MFR is changed.
Register for Enable Pin for Dithered Mode.
Register for Bypass Function of PLL.
Whether to enable AFC and auto-calibration for VCO.
If AFC_ENB is 1, AFC is disabled and VCO is calibrated manually by this value for the test of VCO range.
FIXME: Source for enabling clock buffering.
For sharing PLL signals with other modules, user can set this register before enabling the PLL.
Clock I-Q Phase Change Control Register.
Data I-Q Phase Change Control Register.
For using shared clock and clock signals by PLL of external module, user can set this register without enabling the PLL in this module.
Source for releasing clock divider reset.
Register for Controlling the Charge-Pump Current.
Register for Value of 2-bit Modulation Method Control. PLL has to be reset if SEL_PF is changed.
Whether to enable clock gating, or not (when PLL_WCLK_EN is asserted).
Word Clock Buffer Shift Count Control Register. Value = Roundup((Word Clock Period) / 38.46 + 2)
For measuring frequency in ATE test environment, user can set this register and measure the divided clock frequency at the port PLL_TEST_DIV_TM.
Bit Clock /2 Divider Output Enable Control Register.
Bit Clock /4 Divider Output Enable Control Register.
Bit Clock /8 Divider Output Enable Control Register.

Count value of PLL lock indication. After setting PLL_EN register, PHY lock counter starts to count. When count value reaches to the value of this register, PLL_LOCK(M%_PLL_STAT0[0]) is set to HIGH. Generally, 200us is needed for locking the PLL.

Count value of PLL stablization. After signal PLL_CFG_UPDT is asserted for frequency hopping function, PHY stabilizing counter starts to count. When count value reaches to the value of this register, signal PLL_CFG_READY is set to HIGH. Generally, 100us is needed for stablizing PLL in frequency hopping.

This register is set when output clock of PLL is locked and ready to operate after setting PLL_EN. User can control setting timing of this register using PLL_LOCK_CNT(M0_PLL_CON7[15:0]) register. And user can control ENABLE register of each Lanes after PLL_LOCK is set.

This register is set when PHY is ready to operate after stablizing bias. User can control setting timing of this register using DPHY_SC_GNR_CON1[T_PHY_READY]. And user should release the RESETN of the Lane after all of PHY_READY register in lanes are set.
For using Lane, user can set this register after PLL is locked.

Count value of PHY ready indication. When setting ENABLE register, PHY ready counter starts to count. And when count value reaches to the value of this register, DPHY_SC_GNR_CON0[PHY_READY] is set to HIGH. Generally, 200us is needed for stablizing the bias and the ready counter operates with Reference Clocks.
Output Resistor of HSRX AFE's 1st Stage Amp.
Diff to CMOS Level shifter's current
EQ Capacitor Control (Covered Freq.) Register. MSB[2]: gain/freq control of 2nd amp
Skew Calibration Clock Rate Control Register. Fin is input clock speed.
Termination control pin for DPHY HS-RX.
Clock delay control for loopback test at Clock lane.
Low Power Escape Clock Polarity selection.
Low Power Pulse Reject Time Control.
Slave D-PHY I bias control (Clock Lane).

This count value is used in High-Speed Transmit operation. There is a watchdog timer in Receive logic for detecting Clock Miss. If the clock is not detected in Slave Clock Lane until the watchdog timer is expired, then internal flag is set.
This count value is used in High-Speed Transmit operation. For getting detailed information of this timing specification, please refer to "Specification for D-PHYSM" of mipi alliance.

This register is set when PHY is ready to operate after stablizing bias. User can control setting timing of this register using COMBO_SDx_GNR_CON1[T_PHY_READY]. And user should release the RESETN of the Lane after all of PHY_READY register in lanes are set.
For using Lane, user can set this register after PLL is locked.

Count value of PHY ready indication. When setting ENABLE register, PHY ready counter starts to count. And when count value reaches to the value of this register, COMBO_SDx_GNR_CON0[PHY_READY] is set to HIGH. Generally, 200us is needed for stablizing the bias and the ready counter operates with Reference Clocks.
Diff to CMOS Level shifter's current
EQ Resistor Control Register. Shows D-PHY only, C-DPHY config is unsure.
EQ Capacitor Control (Covered Freq.) Register. MSB[2]: gain/freq control of 2nd amp. Shows D-PHY only, C-DPHY config is unsure.
Fine delay on/off control pin for skew calibration, DPHY only.
Fine delay selection for Skew calibration, DPHY only.
Clock selection pin for Data patch clock.
Termination control pin for DPHY HS-RX.
UI mask code output control - sec control
UI data sampling type - sec control
XI to doubler clock delay cotrol - sec control
Settle Counter Clock Select Register. Settle Clock is used for counting TCLK-SETTLE.

TSETTLE Timing Counter Register. This count value is used in High-Speed Transmit operation. For getting detailed information of this timing specification, please refer to "Specification for D-PHYSM" of mipi alliance.

SoT Sync Error Detect Timing Control Register. This count value is used in High-Speed Transmit operation. There is a watchdog timer in Receive logic for detecting SoT Sync Error. If the Sync Pattern is not detected until the watchdog timer is expired, then the PPI signal "ERRSOTSYNC" goes to HIGH.
When this register is set to HIGH, 7-symbol data will be swapped.
When this register is set to HIGH, the data input of DP/DN will be inverted.
When this register is set to HIGH, 16-bit data output will be swapped.
Skew Calibration Clock Division Ratio Control Register.
Skew Calibration Final Compare Time Control Register.
Skew Calibration Compare Tolerance Control Register.
Skew Calibration Compare Wait Time Control Register.
Skew Calibration Compare Run Time Control Register.
Skew Calibration Manual Data Coarse Delay Control Register.
Skew Calibration Manual Data Fine Delay Control Register.
Skew Calibration Manual Data Fine Falling Delay Control Register.
Skew Calibration Manual Data Fine Rising Delay Control Register.
Skew Calibration Manual Clock Fine Falling Delay Control Register.
Skew Calibration Manual Clock Fine Rising Delay Control Register.
Skew Calibration Maximum Fine Delay Step Control Register.
Skew Calibration Maximum Coarse Delay Step Control Register.
CRC Forcing Mode Code Control Register.
CRC SoT Sync Error Check Enable Register.
CRC Multiple Burst Count for Average Code Register.
Fine delay on/off control pin for skew calibration.
Fine delay selection for Skew calibration.
Clock selection pin for Data patch clock.
Termination control pin for DPHY HS-RX.
When this register is set to HIGH, the data input of DP/DN will be inverted.
When this register is set to HIGH, 16-bit data output will be swapped.
